A QUESTIONNAIRE

Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name Mr. Morley W. Brown
Address South Dakota
Birthplace P. A., Minnesota, U.S.A.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in western Canada? 1904
Where did you set up housekeeping? At Minn. S.W. Smith on land
Where had you been living before that? Tingwall Falls, Minn., U.S.A.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? 3 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a month
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Tea, coffee - a little sugar, dried fruit, oatmeal, flour

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Weyburn mill
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lb. each
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? Approximately $3.50
How much did you use graham flour? 1 lb. flour, year
Whole wheat flour? 1 lb. flour, year
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 3 miles
What year? 1904-5
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 10 cents
What other grain products did you use? Corn meal
Corn meal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? Yes
Oats? Yes
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? By hand
